intro: Anemonidium peruvianum, commonly known as the Peruvian anemonidium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other related genera. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive, cup-shaped structure that resembles a small cup. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological study.
